titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize LJS 55: L'image del monde ... etc.

notesStmt.note: Title for manuscript from title of predominant work (f. 1r).

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Copy of the version in verse (written continuously without line breaks, like prose) of Gautier's encyclopedic treatise discussing cosmology, astronomy, meteorology, geography, natural science, and religion. Many of the headings, which are generally just the incipits of the sections that follow, have been crossed out, with a correction added in the margin. This work is followed by 3 others: the Lucidaire, an anonymous thirteenth-century prose version and vernacular translation of Honorius Augustodunensis's eleventh-century Elucidarius, a dogmatic explanation of Catholic doctrine in the form of a dialogue between a schoolmaster and pupil; the Moralites (des philosophes); and chapter 18 and part of chapter 19 of the first part of Aldobrandino da Siena's Régime du corps, instructions on pregnancy and caring for a newborn. Most of the Lucidaire and the Régime du corps are missing due to three bifolia missing from both the sixth and eighth gatherings. The signatures of the gatherings and one early folio number (77, f. 4r) suggest that this manuscript is a piece of a larger manuscript.

msItem.title: Per bien entendre ce que vos dirons, f. 52r

supportDesc.extent: 52 leaves : 320 x 232 (238 x 144) mm. bound to 333 x 246 mm

collation.p: Parchment, 52 ; 1-5⁸ 6⁸(-2, -3, -4, -5, -6, -7) 7⁸ 8⁸(-2, -3, -4, -5, -6, -7); gatherings 1-7 signed xxiii-xxviiii, lower right of last verso; modern foliation in pencil, [1-52], upper right recto. Catchwords, lower right of last verso.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns of 43 lines; frame-ruled in lead with double outer vertical bounding lines; prickings in outer margin on some leaves.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a French Gothic book script.

decoDesc.decoNote: numerous diagrams (f. 8-27v), mostly astronomical or cosmological, but including a T-O world map (f. 10r); 5-line initial in red with floral decoration and penwork in red and blue (f. 1r); 3 3-line initials with contrasting penwork (f. 28r, 42r); numerous 2-line initials in red or blue with penwork in one contrasting color or in 2 colors, sometimes incorporating fish shapes in second work (f. 28r-31r); headings in red; sketch in red ink of king being blessed by hand of God extending from cloud (f. 10v); occasional manicules in red ink (f. 8r, 17r, 26r, 28r).
Drawing, King being blessed by hand of God extending from cloud, f. 10v
Decorated initial, Initial L, Fish, f. 28r
Decorated initial, Initial P, Fish, f. 29r
Decorated initial, Initial Q, Fish, f. 29v
Decorated initial, Initial Q, Fish, f. 30r
Decorated initial, Initial O, Fish, f. 31r
Decorated initial, Initial Q, Face, f. 35v

origin.p: Written in France, possibly Lorraine, in the late 13th century.

history.provenance: Appeared in H. P. Kraus's cat. 80 (1956), no. 117, and cat. 155 (1980), no. 6.
Formerly owned by Harrison D. Horblit (Ridgefield, Conn.), shelf number H12487 (pencil note, inside lower cover).
Sold by H. P. Kraus to Lawrence J. Schoenberg, Sept. 1996.
Gift of Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle in honor of H. Carton Rogers, Vice Provost and Director of Libraries, 2012.
